intro: Pseudabutilon hitchcockii, commonly known as the desert abutilon, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Due to its adaptability and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in regions with suitable climates.
